artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Yorozuya Magobei; Carver: Ōta Tashichi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 331.7; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 283.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: one sheet; woman leaning toward her right, looking down and toward her left; woman's kimono partially open, exposing portion of her PL breast; PL hand on shoulder, with arm beneath red and white cloth; grey kimono with purple and turquoise flowers
markings: Artist’s seal L: 芳年 {Yoshitoshi} | Carver’s seal: 彫工秀勝 {horikō Hidekatsu}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Mirror of Women, Ancient and Modern (Kokon hime kagami 古今姫鑑)
signed: 応需大蘇芳年画 {ōju Taiso Yoshitoshi ga}
title: Chiyojo
